column9: I was given this during a c section and I broke out in a serious rash all over my body.

column2: winnie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took ancef when I had knee replacement,every since then I have had a white tongue .Doctors says a overgrowth of fungus but it happen after I took ancef.Cannot get it cleared up.Need some one to tell me how to get rid of this had it since right after surgery in Febuary 2011 Thanks.

column2: Emma, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Before breast (malignancy?) operation had serious digestive problems, pain, nausea, pale coloured stools floating on top of water. After IV Ancef all these conditions have cleared up - what a bonus!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
xstitchn1grmme, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this for about 30 minutes before a surgery to remove breast cyst and swollen lymph gland. I broke out in a rash on my upper chest/lower throat area. I am allergic to penicillin and sulfa drugs, so the surgeon was doing a test dose. It is now on my list of medical allergies.

column2: tcxfw5, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it was give to me right before knee surgery i had a anaphylactic reaction. i like to die.i think this should be took off medication list for surgery.

column2: Cheryl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this drug for surgery to prevent infection. I had a severe allergic reaction.Swelling in face, hands, legs, and throat. I turned red and my blood pressure went to 28/15.

column2: grannylegal, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I broke out in hives on my back, upper legs, lower stomach with blisters.  I would NOT recommend this antibiotic.  I have been told I was allegic to penicillian for years and according to all I have read, this should not have been used.

column2: football player, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was having shoulder surgery. It made me very talkative, sunburn like on face and chest, pulse was racing. Nurse stopped the iv and i went to sleep.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My mother was given this antibiotic for same day surgery for Kidney Stones.  Her whole body turned red and her body swelled up.  She had no previous allergies to penicillin.

column2: Nanny, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went into anaphalaxis shock from taking this IV before surgery - spent two days in the hospital.  I have never been alergic to any medications.  This was on November 13 2007.  I was told by an allergy doctor that Ancef is an old medicine of the 1950,s.
